body_html:
A little, though jt's different from checkpoint recovery because it doesn't require restarting a session or an additional session.run for the current one.
…
On Tue, May 22, 2018, 10:03 make1980 ***@***.***> wrote: @ajbouh <https://github.com/ajbouh> I see. Essentially we want to reconstruct the state by re-computation on the failed over node. This is similar idea as checkpoint based state recovery. I think this is definitely helpful. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body:
A little, though jt's different from checkpoint recovery because it doesn't
require restarting a session or an additional session.run for the current
one.

On Tue, May 22, 2018, 10:03 make1980 <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @ajbouh <https://github.com/ajbouh> I see. Essentially we want to
> reconstruct the state by re-computation on the failed over node. This is
> similar idea as checkpoint based state recovery. I think this is definitely
> helpful.
>
